title: Data collection

source.description:
Once you have received the link to download your dataset, download the csv file locally.
Make sure to save it on your computer in a convenient folder!
In this protocol we will perform the data collection on a test dataset:

As you can see in this test dataset, some preliminary information have been collected automatically such as the article name, authors and publication date.
However some information will need additional efforts to be collected, such as the database name, link and availability.

In the dataset, you'll find a column name "DOI", this is a usique identifier given to all scientific publications. This allows to easily find the article online.
In order to access the paper search in you web browser :
https://doi.org/ + DOI number
In the first example it would be: https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkaa818

The first information you need to collect is the name of the database! It seem trivial, but people use acronyms and are often not consistent in naming databases. So be careful!
There is mainly two possibilities: either the article is presenting a new database or it is an article about an update of an already published database

cases.title: New database
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ecrr","text":"If your article is about a new database, you'll need to look at the title and abstract to find the name of the database.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tn53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tdp3","text":"In the first example of the test set, the abstract of the article statrs by \"We introduce the Nucleome Data Bank (NDB), a web-based platform to  simulate and analyze the three-dimensional (3D) organization of genomes.\" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"518mn","text":"Since the database name has two version, an acronym and a full name, you'll need to report both in the column \"resource_name\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":111,"length":13,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68bin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brld4","text":"Here it would be: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":18,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8qdu","text":"    NDB: Nucleome Data Bank","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":27,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l9dn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"867je","text":"If only one name exists, simply report the name in the \"ressource_name\" column","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: New version of a database
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0fsf","text":"Sometimes, article are about a new version of an already published database! ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm4h6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"absa9","text":"As an example: the second and third article in the test dataset looks like they are articles about updates of an existing database.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11sv1","text":"\"Here, we present BacWGSTdb 2.0, which encompasses several major updates...\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":76,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qvh8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sl3t","text":"First, you need to add \"TRUE\" in the column \"previously_published\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ms5i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79a09","text":"Then, you'll need to check if the database was previously mentionned in the DB Justice League. To do so, go to the database interface and search the name of the database in the search box","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3li73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51mpi","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"1e7e7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnpsc","text":"In this example, you see that the database was previously reported in the DB Justice League repository. Copy the name that was given to the database in the \"resource_name\" column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h8sb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2139d","text":"BEWARE: It is possible that the previous paper for the database is not in the DB Justice League repository. It is the case for the second example in the test dataset. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":7,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88jvg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pniu","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7dugi","text":"In that case, you get to create the name of the database! If the database has a single name, report the name in the \"resource_name\" column. If the dtabase has two names (an acronym and a full name), report it as:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oge9","text":"    accronym: full name (e.g. ApiDB: Apicomplexan DataBase)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":23,"length":36,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f3q0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7C604300C6D111EBB7BB7F6510A51EB5","id":114407,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/drzh2kge.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/drzi2kge.png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2021-06-06 at 5.14.01 PM.png","mime":"image/png","shadow":false,"is_video":false,"width":550,"height":155,"legend":"","nestedSelector":null}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0D714BE0C6D311EBB7BB7F6510A51EB5","id":114409,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/drzj2kge.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/drzk2kge.png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2021-06-06 at 5.25.17 PM.png","mime":"image/png","shadow":false,"is_video":false,"width":550,"height":154,"legend":"","nestedSelector":null}}}}

source.description:
Next, we need to find if the database is accessible online, and if yes, what is its URL.
Usually, the link will be displayed in the abtract (often at the end of the abstract) of the article. As an example in the first article of the test set:
"The NDB is available at
https://ndb.rice.edu
."
Report the URL (
https://ndb.rice.edu
) in the table under the "current_access" column

Finally we need to assess if the database is accessible or not.
To do so, first, click on the database URL that you have identified.

cases.title: The URL is accessible
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4kgtk","text":"The URL resolve and you see the website of the database? This is great!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btdnb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f53a","text":"Under the \"available\" column put \"yes\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: The website is not accessible

source.description:
Great job!
Your table should now look like this:
You can upload the completed dataset to D2L.

Next, we need to find the database URL. In general, the URL is mentionned in the article abstract.
As an example for the first article in the test dataset, you see in the article abstract:
"The NDB aims to be a shared resource to biologists, biophysicists and all genome scientists. The NDB is available at
https://ndb.rice.edu
."
Here you need to report the full URL (
https://ndb.rice.edu
) under the "current_access" column.

Finally, we need to assess if the URL for the database is working. Click on the URL you identified!
Two possibilities: The URL is working or not!

cases.title: URL working
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7h95","text":"The URL is working AND it gives you the database you were expecting to see? Great job!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nd0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flhq4","text":"Write \"Yes\" under the \"available\" column in the table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":54,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: URL not working
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b78rt","text":"Something is wrong and you get an error, or a blank page... Or even a page but not the database you were expecting?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0cfg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a8vg","text":"No panic, just write \"No\" under the \"available\" column in the table. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":69,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h7i3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lcp6","text":"Additionally, describe the problem you are facing by writing the appropriate case in the \"unavailable_message\" column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7bu5","text":"Not found","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu2pc","text":"can't be reached","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11q2m","text":"related generic reseach institution site redirect","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64dr2","text":"service unabailable","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87lgp","text":"forbidden","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60g6d","text":"Discontinued notice","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90fd6","text":"related generic government site redirect","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24g79","text":"malware warning","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bp71","text":"related generic commercial site redirect","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap6si","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: This protocols aims to details the steps necessary to collect new data points for the "Database Justice League" project.
